thread.title: Breast cancer sufferer third man in family to have disease
thread.title_full: Breast cancer sufferer third man in family to have disease

title: Breast cancer sufferer third man in family to have disease
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Breast cancer sufferer third man in family to have disease 6 February 2017 Last updated at 00:48 GMT 
Two men in Giles Cooper's family died after being diagnosed with breast cancer, then he got the disease. 
Mr Cooper, from Conderton, Worcestershire, underwent a double mastectomy and is now hoping to increase awareness it's not just an illness affecting women. 
He's part of a long-term study by Breast Cancer Now charity which is investigating the disease in men. 
BBC Inside Out West Midlands features this story at 19:30 GMT on BBC One on Monday 6 February. It will be available afterwards on iPlayer. Read more
